page.title: 05CARTERTON INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
page.content: The estate was developed in 1967 on{15 {acres}of backland sold with the aim of bringing jobs into the town for the local workforce. Today the units are used for{light industry and {warehousing.}A village blacksmith moved there as he expanded and now a thriving{steel fabricating company.} A plastic moulding company began in 1968 which currently employs 51 people manufacturing traffic cones and rubber gloves. A{paving company}opened in 1979 which produces slabs in 1550 varieties of shapes,sizes and colours to supply builders and garden centres within a 100 miles radius of Carterton. In 1981 a luxury{furniture {manufacturing company}moved here from Moreton in Marsh for easier access to London. 43 skilled workers are employed producing hand made furniture for expensive London hotels.
